name: Jonathan Sudlow
body:
### Contact Info
Email: jsudlow@gmail.com

Phone: (618) 351-7073

Web: cnjproconsulting.com

### Personal Summary
I am a passionate software engineer. I have studied computer science and have
obtained an undergraduate and graduate degree in the field. I am results oriented
and self motivated. My experience working as a consultant has exposed me to
numerous languages, coding styles and techniques. I would be delighted to build off
those experiences and put them to work for your company.

### Degrees Earned
**Bachelor of Arts in Computer Science**, May 2009
North Park University, Chicago, IL

Graduated with 3.29 Cumulative G.P.A. on a 4.0 scale

**Masters of Science in Computer Science**, Dec 2011
Northern Illinois University, DeKalb,IL

Graduated with 3.47 Cumulative G.P.A. on a 4.0 scale

Emphasis in Databases, Software Engineering and Security

### Professional Experience
**CNJ Consulting Nov 2012 – Present**

_Co CEO_

I operate the entire IT infrastructure for the company. I direct the creation and
deployment of websites for small businesses. Every business is different and we
target common sense and cost effective solutions to stream line business IT
operations. Within our realm of consulting we offer clients several electronic and
virtual products. In addition I direct the collection of virtual assets in the various accounts CNJ and its partners have invested with. Leveraging our assets and
expertise CNJ strives to generate revenue in an ever changing landscape.

**Network Ninja Mar 2012 – Nov 2012**

_Application Developer_

I worked on a product called Legal Server. It is a case management system for non
profit legal organizations. They brought me in, setup the Mac, gave me SVN access
and I was hacking from day one. My best project was a case auditing system that
determines when certain legal cases needed attention. The system included fully
integrated options panel for the admin interface. Using Trac, I fielded every kind of
ticket imaginable. Display problems, code problems, interface issues, bugs and
unknowns were common. The code base was eight years old and massive. Even so, I
still found my way around and made meaningful improvements to the company.
Through the help of my team they turned me into a very confident programmer.

**Maverick Business Ventures Apr 2011 – Mar 2012**

_Application Developer_

I worked on a product called Simplicity. Simplicity is a business marketing platform
deployed on the web and written in PHP. Creation of email lists, email campaigns,
result tracking, click trough’s and PPC campaigns are some of the features in the
product. I also helped manage the Django version of MobSav and assisted in white listing it so we could sell it world wide. 

I assist the support team when problems with the application go above their
knowledge.

I administer the database back ups and make sure they look good and are in tact. I
created a set of scripts in python that allow our client data to be mobile across any of
our databases.

_Web Consultant_

I am responsible for all forward functional development and estimation on new web
site contracts. Most of the web sites utilize a framework or are written from scratch in
PHP, Python or Ruby. I estimate the project given the initial specs and work with a team of account
managers to complete client projects. I talk with clients on the phone/email/in person
and enjoy meeting their challenges and goals. I am available to my clients 24/7.
I understand how to configure web sites with Apache, setup FTP the right way,
configure and install SSL along with many other httpd type configurations. I have a
lot of experience using Linux and use it extensively.I have experience in helping clients get through the process of obtaining and integrating gateway APIs for merchant accounts into their own sites. I have
integrated credit cards, ACH, E-Check and check21 signature services. I have an
existing relationship with key members at Willow-Payments, Zambio, CC-Bill,
Authorize.net and Allied Wallet.

**Simplex Investments Jan 2011 - Feb 2011**

_Junior Developer_
Worked in the Order Routing department for high frequency volatile options trading
and arbitrage. Used Perl to develop monitoring and analytic tools to parse through
logs of executed trades. Learned about the back end connections between local
servers and the different exchanges throughout the country. I was exposed to the
InstaQuote, FIX, Arcadirect and Boxdirect protocols.
PRH Consulting May 2010 - July 2010
Actionscript 3.0 Flash Developer
Designed and developed a custom sales training product using Flash. Extended the
Command Force product to feature a completely guided and step by step tool which
presented questions to the user at every screen. As the user answered questions the
program would monitor responses and calculate a decision of whether or not to
pursue a sales opportunity.

**Recovery Solutions 2010**

_DR Computer Technician_

Interfaced with clients from regional banks around the Chicago area. Worked with IT
staff to deliver, setup, install and configure critical banking software/hardware
systems. Was exposed to the entire DR process. Learned VMware suite of tools and
how it is deployed on servers as part of a DR solution.

**Intertech Marketing 2009**

_Website Developer_

Developed a website that sells silver and gold jewelry. Used WordPress software with
available plugins, along with some custom code to make all features of the site. Made
an interactive brochure using Adobe Photoshop and Adobe In-Design.

**North Park University 2008**

_Website Developer_

Designed and developed the Axelson gateway website. Site uses open source Drupal
PHP backend with custom forms for searching/posting jobs, news and articles. Site
includes individual user accounts and automated account support. Content is
formatted and designed to fit the needs and likenesses of the users. Implemented
security systems and configured search engines optimization for link placement in
the search pane.

### Summary of Professional Skills
Summary of Professional Skills:

Programming Languages:

   * PHP
   * Python
   * Perl

Operating Systems:
   * Linux
   * Windows
   * OSX
   * Web Servers:
   * Apache
   * Microsoft IIS
   * E commerce:
   * Merchant Integration
   * ACH IntegrationCheck21 e-check integration
   * Zend Carts and templates

Web Frameworks:
   * Word Press
   * Drupal
   * Elgg

Databases:
   * MySQL
   * Postgres

Software Deployment/Version Tools:
   * Git
   * SVN

### Academic Experience
_CSCI-567 Software Engineering_

Learned principles and methodology of how to understand client requirements.
Learned how to translate client requirements into viable use cases. I learned how to
estimate software costs using real world planning and response strategies. Exposed
to COCOMO software estimation technique.

_CSIS-687 Databases and Information Systems_

Learned about MySQL programming. Exposed to database design fundamentals,
relational algebra, query tuning and core concepts. Fully learned the relational
database model, the data control language, data manipulation language and data
definition language. I use these concepts to build on my understanding for how
MySQL operates. I used C++ and PHP to query databases and build basic applications for the web. I took my comprehensive exam in this subject and it is my
strongest.

_CSIS-2230 Object Oriented Programming_

Learned the basics of OOP, the Python language and its standard library. I found a
love for Python in my first year of college. Classes, objects and functions come easy
in python. Ease of access in overriding fundamental behaviors between objects is the
basis for why I use Python to build complex objects. The great built in data types and
structures, access to wonderful 3rd party API's already written and a suburb support
community on IRC make Python one of the most attractive languages to write in.
References available upon request
